text:
Hi I am new to the Julia language. I am trying to do a circular convolution like what this Matlab function does: <https://www.mathworks.com/help/signal/ref/cconv.html>. Do you know of any packages and functions I can use to accomplish the same thing?
I found the FFTW.jl and FastTransforms.jl packages but I'm having issues with understanding the documentation provided on github. I can't figure out what functions are inside FFTW.jl nor what the input arguments are for the functions in FastTransforms.jl.

attachments.title: Modulo-n circular convolution - MATLAB cconv
attachments.text: This MATLAB function convolves vectors a and b.

elements.text: Hi I am new to the Julia language. I am trying to do a circular convolution like what this Matlab function does:

. Do you know of any packages and functions I can use to accomplish the same thing?
I found the FFTW.jl and FastTransforms.jl packages but I'm having issues with understanding the documentation provided on github. I can't figure out what functions are inside FFTW.jl nor what the input arguments are for the functions in FastTransforms.jl.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/hi-i-am-new-to-the-julia-language-i-am-trying-to-do-a-circular-convolution-like-w/54572|to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

You may not have seen the link to the docs for FFTW.jl. <https://juliamath.github.io/FFTW.jl/stable/fft.html|Link>.
This should describe how to use that library.
